title: "The Power of Emotions and Fascination in Relationships"
first_phrase: This text explores the concept of fascination and its connection to our basic emotions and the desire for power and a partner. The author delves into how humans share the same basic needs as animals: securing a mate and prey. They identify three primary emotions that often facilitate fascination and examine how this phenomenon is linked to our reptilian brain. In the last 200 tokens, the text discusses the contributing factors to fascination, such as the gaze of a lover or envious individual, and how experiences that result in a positive outcome tend to become part of our belief system.
content: El análisis del mundo animal señala cómo el hombre tiene las mismas necesidades básicas de los animales: Asegúrese su pareja y la presa. El mecanismo detrás del poder de la imaginación vinculados a estos elementos básicos sucede de dos maneras: o bien, en todo caso, porque los conceptos en cuestión representan los universales, sea porque cuando la experiencia es seguida por un resultado positivo (ganar el socios y presas) tiende a convertirse en una parte del sistema de creencias de una persona y restringe su atención a pocos elementos significativos. En el momento de la a fascinación sobre la base de estos elementos a fin de llegar a la naturaleza más profunda del hombre y de los mecanismos relacionados con el cerebro reptil. Obviamente, en el hombre las exigencias de la presa y de la pareja toman una amplitud diversa. Podemos resumir tres emociones básicas que en su mayoría facilitan la a fascinación.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the analysis of the animal world reveals that humans share basic needs with animals, such as mating and prey. The power of imagination is linked to these basic elements in two ways, either because these concepts represent universals or because successful experiences become part of a person's belief system and restrict their attention to a few significant elements. To reach the deeper nature of humans and the mechanisms related to the reptilian brain, it is important to understand the fascination that these basic emotions of sex, hunger, and fear can bring. These emotions can easily activate the necessary energy for fascination, which requires an increase in vigilance and a narrowing of attention. Physical symptoms such as dilated pupils are also observed during these situations.
